TableColumnsTooltips.Dcs:
Data Coding Scheme. Possible values are:
  • 0: SMSC Default Alphabet,
  • 1: IA5 (CCITT T.50)/ASCII (ANSI X3.4),
  • 2: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1),
  • 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 5: JIS (X 0208-1990),
  • 6: Cyrllic (ISO-8859-5),
  • 7: Latin/Hebrew (ISO-8859-8),
  • 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646),
  • 9: Pictogram Encoding,
  • 10: ISO-2022-JP (Music Codes),
  • 11: Reserved,
  • 12: Reserved,
  • 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990),
  • 14: KS C 5601,
  • 15: Reserved.

TableColumnsTooltips.Date: Date and time of the subscription event.
TableColumnsTooltips.TransactionId: Unique ID generated for each subscription related transaction. Transaction ID shall be used for problem diagnosis within product traces and logs.
TableColumnsTooltips.EventType: Subscription event's type, it may be initial subscription, renewal, charging, subscriber or service notification related. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific event type details.
TableColumnsTooltips.ErrorCode: Related error code in case event denotes a failure. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific error code details.
TableColumnsTooltips.ChannelType:
Channel that is triggering the event. Possible channels are:
  • IVR
  • USSD
  • SMS
  • WEB
  • SSM
  • DCB
  • CC: Customer Care
  • PROV: Operator Provisioning System
  • TP: Third-Party
  • MOA: Mobile Application
  • OTHER
TableColumnsTooltips.State: Subscription's state. Possible states are: PENDING, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, INACTIVE.
TableColumnsTooltips.InactivationReason:
Subscription\'s inactivation reason. Field is only available and meaningful for inactive subscriptions. Possible inactivation reasons are:
  • InactivatedBySubscriber: Inactivation requested by the Subscriber from Customer Care or a Self-Care channel.
  • MaxFailedChargingAttemptCountExceeded: Inactivated by the System because max charging attempt count (# of free charging periods) reached.
  • SubscriptionDurationEnded: Inactivated by the System because Subscription end date is reached.
  • InsufficientCredit: Inactivated by the system because Subscriber didn\'t have enough credit for renewal.
  • RenewalNotConfirmed: Inactivated by the System because Subscriber didn\'t confirm subscription renewal.
  • SubscriberInBlackList: Subscriber is in black list.
  • SubscriberNotActive: Subscriber is not in active state.
  • SubscriberNotEligible: Subscriber is not eligible.
TableColumnsTooltips.SubscriberNotificationType: Type of the Subscriber notification. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific subscriber notification type.
